title: Question:
author: Loco1887
content: If you had to make a decision between Elrond and NEAR Protocol, which one would you choose?

comments.author: CuriousGeorge
comments.body: Quote from: Loco1887 on August 12, 2022, 09:18:18 PMIf you had to make a decision between Elrond and NEAR Protocol, which one would you choose?If i profit oriented and then i will be going for near but if i was looking for usability from the platform and i will pick near. It can be said that elrond's marketcap already below near and that's why looking for more profit from elrond still make sense compared with looking for profit from a coin with a greater marketcap compared with elrond. So, what will you choose? i have been answering your question.Â  Near is far popular compared with elrond.

comments.author: Anonylz
comments.body: Quote from: Loco1887 on August 13, 2022, 08:02:55 AMSo NEAR has less potential to grow?What do you mean less potential to grow? i believe he already point out the different reason for each investment, potential wise Near still has a lot to offer which will increase its growth. Maybe news like this 20 million JavaScript devs can now build applications on NEAR: KBW 2022 will give you a closure the possibilities of projects like near. The potential to grow will always be there as long as the devs are ready to keep working hard. It is a matter of time for such project to develop to their full potential.

comments.author: X-ray
comments.body: Both have the same potential but again that depend on what people saw from both. People prefer to use near to build their dapps. I know that elrond was good but i rarely hear that there are some popular dapps that from there. During the bullish market and it doesn't matter what kind of altcoin it is. The both have the same chance to grow as long as bitcoin was also growing as well.

comments.author: Wincob
comments.body: Quote from: Loco1887 on August 13, 2022, 08:02:55 AMSo NEAR has less potential to grow?Judging by the market cap you will make more money from NEAR than Elrond, smaller market cap means higher returns in a bull market, I hope you understand that, if you have a large fund then it's even smarter to invest in the two projects.

comments.author: waONE
comments.body: Quote from: Loco1887 on August 12, 2022, 09:18:18 PMIf you had to make a decision between Elrond and NEAR Protocol, which one would you choose?these two altcoin projects are very good, but for investing of course I prefer Elrond, with a supply of only 23 million and the price is still below $1000 of course it's still very cheap for EGLD, that's why EGLD is better than NEAR which has a lot of supply

comments.author: ethereumhunter
comments.body: Quote from: Loco1887 on August 14, 2022, 07:23:09 AMSo none of these two projects is bad?I think the two projects can develop in the future if each team project sticks to its plans and doesn't go off the beaten path. It's not easy for me to say whether Near or Elrond will be better because both projects are relatively new to crypto. If you want to find a coin that is cheaper and is in the top 25 list, Near is your choice. But that doesn't mean Elrond is not a good or expensive project and is in the #49 position because it will depend on how each team can maintain its performance.

comments.author: CuriousGeorge
comments.body: Quote from: Loco1887 on August 13, 2022, 08:02:55 AMSo NEAR has less potential to grow?No, that's not true at all. I meant the popularity makes near being choosen by so many people compared with elrond. In my opinion that if elrond has less potential compared with near in term of adoption. You must also remember if adoption is a key that was also pushing the price and marketcap to be even higher. I think you can take your own conclusion. It's quite easy to know which better from both.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: I am more familiar with near but I'm not an investor of it. Upon looking at their website, I've known that they've got a lot of features to offer, not just for the token but for its use case and utility as a blockchain.They're helping to build people to become developers and as well as educators of their own blockchain. So, I think this is really a plus even if it's focused on their own blockchain but still gives a glimpse for the entire blockchain and cryptocurrencies.

comments.author: FirmWars
comments.body: None of these two projects are bad, I recommend investing in both for better ROI in next bull market by 2024 or 2025, they are good examples of well developed and supported projects in this space.

comments.author: waONE
comments.body: EGLD VS NEAR? very interesting to discuss because these two coins are in the top 100 coinmarketcap rank, where the project has good fundamentals, and can be said to be a competitor to Ethereum, and if I had to choose, of course I would prefer NEAR to EGLD.

comments.author: RussiaUkraineTranslation
comments.body: I would vote NEAR every day, it isn't even a contest
